Authors:
Anthony Dias Cavalcanti, Ana Carla da Silva Santos, Layanne
Oliveira Ferro, Jadson DP Bezerra, Cristina Maria Souza-Motta, Oliane
M.C. Magalhães
Title:
New endophytic Fusarium species from Handroanthus
chrysotrichus (Bignoniaceae) in the Brazilian Atlantic Forest
Keywords:
Fusarium fujikuroi species complex, Fusarium lateritium
species complex, Fungal taxonomy, Phylogeny
Abstract:
In this study we report the discovery and characterization
of two new Fusarium species isolated as endophytes from leaves of
Handroanthus chrysotrichus (Bignoniaceae) in the Atlantic Forest of
northeastern Brazil. Partial rDNA sequences encompassing the internal
transcribed spacers 1 and 2 (ITS), RNA polymerase II second largest
subunit (RPB2), translation elongation factor EF-1 alpha (TEF1), and
β-tubulin (TUB2) genes were obtained from the four endophytic Fusarium
isolates. Mating type (MAT) loci PCR were used to assess the
reproductive mode of these fungi. Multilocus phylogenetic analyses based
on RPB2, TEF1, and TUB2 sequences demonstrated that the endophytic
isolates belong to two species clearly distinct from all known taxa in
F. fujikuroi and F. lateritium species complexes. These isolates are
heterothallic (self-sterile) with only the HMG domains present. Based in
morphological characters and molecular phylogenetic analyses, are being
proposed Fusarium atlanticum and Fusarium massalimae as novel
species.
